Grouped_Utterances: I think I want to focus on my feelings of depression. Sometimes I feel overwhelmed.

I felt really happy. It was a nice distraction from everything else. I felt lighter afterward. It was nice to escape into a different world for a bit. I still struggle with sleep. I wake up a lot, and it’s frustrating. It felt relieving. I think it helped strengthen our connection. Yes, we’ve been more open with each other. It feels good. I think it’s a mix of worrying about my daughter and feeling stuck in my own life. Sometimes talking to friends helps, but I haven’t done that much lately.

Hi! I’ve been okay. I made an effort to spend time with my granddaughter, and it was nice. We went to the zoo, and she loved it. It was fun to see her excitement. I finally talked to her about my feelings. She was really understanding.
Yes! I set aside some time last weekend to watch a movie, and it felt good to relax. I’ve been trying to limit screen time before bed, but it’s hard to stick to.
I tried it a few more times, and it’s getting easier to focus.
You could try reading a book, listening to calming music, or even doing some gentle stretches before bed.

Yes, I can do that. Reaching out to friends can be really beneficial. Would you like to set a goal to connect with a friend this week? Yes, I think that would help. Great! It could be a simple phone call or even a coffee date. Just something to connect with someone who supports you. I’ll try to do that. You’re welcome. I think we’ve made some great progress today. Let’s recap: you’ll practice mindfulness, incorporate stretching into your bedtime routine, spend time with your granddaughter, and reach out to a friend.
